Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 03:45PM Tina-in-Seattle wrote: Thank you Sharon, I so appreciate all of you.  Over the past 24 hours so many priorities have changed for me.  No matter what the outcome of this, my life will definately change is some way. I just need to be there for my kids, they are all that concern me at the moment just them. Thanks for the hugs, they are just what I need.
Posts.Title: Just starting and very worried Tina-in-Seattle Lizann22

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 04:00PM Tina-in-Seattle wrote: Hi Melissa, my thoughts are with you and my best hopes that all will be well.  We are not telling our kids yet either.  I will when and if I need to.  I have my biopsy on Monday and should have the results by Wednesday.  By then I should be on double doses of Zanax!  As Pam says being strong is highly overrated, I'm as strong as I need to be and then I need to have a breakdown to balance it all out. When is your biopsy?  I will be thinking about you.  Please let me know how you're doing. Tina
Posts.Title: Just starting and very worried Tina-in-Seattle Lizann22

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2009 06:42PM Tina-in-Seattle wrote: Hi Houston, I have been thinking about you all day, I'm sorry but I was blocked from posting for 24 hours seems I posted too much!  LOL! How did your results go.  I hope you received good news.  Please let us know how it turned out.  Congratulations on your grandbaby, they are a joy. Hugging you tight. Tina

Posts.Content: May 5, 2009 05:55PM Tina-in-Seattle wrote: Didle, Your comment about your husband brought back a touching memory for me.  After my decision to have the bilateral mast, I told my husband, "Sorry Babe, but I might be a little rough to look at for awhile."  He responded "At least I'll be looking at you." Does that not give you the will to kick ass!  I'm betting your guy feels the same. Best to you! Tina
